title: Nvidia has become world's 'most important stock,' adding pressure to upcoming earnings report
content: Nvidia has been the primary beneficiary of the AI boom, as a handful of the richest technology companies order billions of dollars of the company's processors.
summary: Nvidia has been the primary beneficiary of the AI boom, as a handful of the richest technology companies order billions of dollars of the company's processors.

title: Mark Zuckerberg says White House 'pressured' Meta to 'censor' Covid-19 content
content: Zuckerberg said it was ultimately Meta's decision to take down any content, but he noted he believes that the alleged "government pressure was wrong."
summary: Zuckerberg said it was ultimately Meta's decision to take down any content, but he noted he believes that the alleged "government pressure was wrong."

title: Xpeng releases mass-market EV with basic driver-assist for less than $20,000
content: Chinese electric car company Xpeng has announced that its mass-market brand Mona will start selling cars for less than $20,000.
summary: Chinese electric car company Xpeng has announced that its mass-market brand Mona will start selling cars for less than $20,000.

title: UK PM Starmer warns of 'painful' October budget to tackle shortfall in public finances
content: "We have no other choice given the situation that we're in. Those with the broadest shoulders should bear the heavier burden," Starmer said.
summary: "We have no other choice given the situation that we're in. Those with the broadest shoulders should bear the heavier burden," Starmer said.

title: Buy now, pay later firm Klarna swings to first-half profit ahead of IPO
content: Klarna said it made an adjusted operating profit in the first half of 2024, swinging into the black as the firm nears a hotly anticipated IPO.
summary: Klarna said it made an adjusted operating profit in the first half of 2024, swinging into the black as the firm nears a hotly anticipated IPO.

title: Russia warns France over Telegram founder's detainment, suggests it may be politically motivated
content: The detainment of Telegram founder Pavel Durov could be considered political if France fails to provide serious evidence of his guilt, the Kremlin said Tuesday.
summary: The detainment of Telegram founder Pavel Durov could be considered political if France fails to provide serious evidence of his guilt, the Kremlin said Tuesday.

title: Russia rains heavy missile, drone attack on Ukraine, a day after strike on key energy infrastructure
content: Waves of Russian drones and missiles assailed Ukraine on Tuesday and killed at least five people, Ukrainian authorities said.
summary: Waves of Russian drones and missiles assailed Ukraine on Tuesday and killed at least five people, Ukrainian authorities said.

title: Britpop legends Oasis reunite for 2025 tour — and demand for tickets is expected to be huge
content: Brothers Liam and Noel Gallagher will put aside a 15-year feud to reunite for a string of shows expected to generate feverish demand.
summary: Brothers Liam and Noel Gallagher will put aside a 15-year feud to reunite for a string of shows expected to generate feverish demand.

title: Sony hikes price of aging PlayStation 5 console in Japan by 19%
content: Sony said its suggested retail price for the PlayStation 5 is 79,980 yen, or $553, up 19% from the previous price.
summary: Sony said its suggested retail price for the PlayStation 5 is 79,980 yen, or $553, up 19% from the previous price.

title: Copper prices near six-week high as one strategist says the 'worst of the correction is over'
content: Copper prices on Tuesday rose to a near six-week high, supported by fresh demand and optimism over the potential for imminent U.S. interest rate cuts.
summary: Copper prices on Tuesday rose to a near six-week high, supported by fresh demand and optimism over the potential for imminent U.S. interest rate cuts.

title: Who is Telegram founder Pavel Durov — and why was he arrested?
content: The Paris Public Prosecutor's Office issued an arrest warrant for Durov in connection to an investigation opened on July 8.
summary: The Paris Public Prosecutor's Office issued an arrest warrant for Durov in connection to an investigation opened on July 8.

title: Volkswagen China is spending lots of time at Xpeng to make new EVs
content: German auto giant Volkswagen is spending more time at Xpeng than the other way around, Xpeng co-president Brian Gu told CNBC on Monday.
summary: German auto giant Volkswagen is spending more time at Xpeng than the other way around, Xpeng co-president Brian Gu told CNBC on Monday.

title: 'A different perspective': This top marine scientist is determined to resolve deep-sea mining's murky future
content: A change of leadership at the International Seabed Authority comes at a time of intense debate about the future for deep-sea mining.
summary: A change of leadership at the International Seabed Authority comes at a time of intense debate about the future for deep-sea mining.

title: Eli Lilly releases new form of weight loss drug Zepbound for half the price to boost access, supply
content: Eli Lilly is offering 2.5-milligram and 5-milligram single-dose vials of Zepbound for $399 per month and $549 per month, respectively.
summary: Eli Lilly is offering 2.5-milligram and 5-milligram single-dose vials of Zepbound for $399 per month and $549 per month, respectively.

title: This high-income region has the least active people globally, WHO report shows
content: About 1.8 billion people did not meet their recommended levels of physical activity in 2022, according to a report by the World Health Organization.
summary: About 1.8 billion people did not meet their recommended levels of physical activity in 2022, according to a report by the World Health Organization.

title: BHP CEO expects a turnaround in China's property sector in year ahead
content: BHP's CEO Mike Henry said he expects China's property sector to see a rebound in the upcoming year on the back of favorable government policies.
summary: BHP's CEO Mike Henry said he expects China's property sector to see a rebound in the upcoming year on the back of favorable government policies.

title: Canada to slap 100% import tariffs on Chinese electric vehicles over 'unfair' competition
content: Canada on Monday said it is imposing a 100% tariff on China-made EV imports, as well as a 25% tariff on steel and aluminium imports from China.
summary: Canada on Monday said it is imposing a 100% tariff on China-made EV imports, as well as a 25% tariff on steel and aluminium imports from China.

title: Nvidia partner says it can cut data center energy use by 50% as AI boom strains power grid

content: PetroChina posted a record-high operating profit for the first half of the year on the back of strong drilling output and higher oil prices.
summary: PetroChina posted a record-high operating profit for the first half of the year on the back of strong drilling output and higher oil prices.

content: The slump comes after the company failed to meet expectations in its second quarter results.

title: You have a right to ignore your bosses — but only in these countries, and after work hours
content: Australia has joined the list of countries that allow employees the "right to disconnect" from work.

title: India wants to be a developed nation by 2047 — but it has to tackle gender inequality first
content: Entrenched sexism still persists in India and the country will need to tackle the obstacle to achieve its economic goals, economic experts say.
summary: Entrenched sexism still persists in India and the country will need to tackle the obstacle to achieve its economic goals, economic experts say.

title: Most Asia markets track declines in key Wall Street indexes; investors assess China industrial profits
content: China reported that its industrial profits from January to July climbed 3.6% year on year, compared to a 3.6% year on year climb from January to June.

title: UBS veteran boss Ermotti may have pulled off the deal of the decade with the Credit Suisse rescue
content: After an intense weekend of negotiations in March 2023, UBS agreed to buy its embattled rival Credit Suisse. But not everyone was convinced it was a good idea.
